Democratic decentralisation and local-level planning are often used interchangeably and viewed as vital for sustainable development, for more accountable governance and– in natural resource management – to enable improved livelihoods and poverty reduction. This paper consolidates and reviews lessons learnt from Rajasthan and elsewhere in India about the positive and negative impacts of decentralised planning on integrated natural resource management, for institutional decentralisation

detailsOfAchievement: The Manipal Education Group with its heritage of excellence in higher education for over 60 years launched Manipal University Jaipur in 2011 The permanent campus of the university is set up on 122 acres of land at Dehmi Kalan village near Jaipur and is by far one of the best campuses in the region MUJ has world class infrastructure including state-of-the-art research facilities and modern library In line with Manipal University legacy of providing quality education the university uses the latest and innovative methods and technology to impart education. The multidisciplinary university offers career-oriented courses at all levels ie UG, PG and Doctoral and across diverse streams, including Engineering Architecture Planning Fashion Design Hospitality Allied Health Sciences Humanities Commerce Management Communication Basic Sciences Fashion Design and Jewellery Management etc The Manipal Education Group has been an inspiring leader in the fields of education research and healthcare for a span of over six decades The group includes five universities, namely Manipal University Manipal Karnataka Sikkim Manipal University Sikkim American University of Antigua Caribbean Island Manipal International University Malaysia and Manipal University Jaipur

title: MANNA TRUST
detailsOfAchievement: MANNA TRUST is an autonomous, not for profit, a public charitable trust working for the development of underprivileged, deprived and marginalized communities and special care for children. Manna Trust registered 10.07.2012 Midday Meal Program (school lunch) emerged to address the multiple challenges of poverty, hunger and access to education. Prior to receiving Midday meal, many impoverished children performed poorly in school due to short attention span associated with extreme hunger.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Manna Trust started supplying Hot cooked nutritious and unlimited food to school going children of Govt Schools, Govt Aided schools, Madrasas in the Year 2014 in the District of Hyderabad ,District of Ranga Reddy and Medchal in the State of Telangana and also in the State of Odisha and the State of Madhya Pradesh.
We are planning to start our operations in Andhra Pradesh to provide mid Day meals through Centralized Kitchens We are expanding our operations in the State of Odhisha in two Districts

Apart from Mid Day Meal scheme which is already operational, we have expanded and also started supplying one full meal under Arogya Lakshmi scheme and Supplementary Nutrition program in the state of Telangana for Women development and Child welfare department to provide Hot cooked meal to pregnant women, lactating mothers and children between the age 3-6 years
